titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Niagara County Records 1808-1830 (1808-1820 bulk )
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Patricia M. Virgil.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.physdesc: 4 boxes, 1 slim box,1 oversize flat box (3.5 linear ft.)
did.abstract: The Niagara County Records represent the accumulated archives between 1808-1830.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Description and dates], Box/folder number, Mss. B00-10, Niagara County Records), Research Library, Buffalo History Museum.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Niagara County Records, 1808-1830, are open for research.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright of papers in the collection may be held by their authors, or the authors' heirs or assigns. Researchers must obtain the written permission of the holder(s) of copyright and the Buffalo History Museum before publishing quotations from materials in the collection.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Please see librarian for acquisition information.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection processed by Patricia M. Virgil, December 1993.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Niagara County was formed in 1808 during a municipal reorganization of the Holland Purchase. The part of Genesee County north of Cattaraugus Creek and west of the line between the fourth and fifth ranges of townships became Niagara County with the town of Buffalo as county seat. These boundaries held until 1821 when the part north of the center of Tonawanda Creek became a separate county called Niagara; the remainder was renamed Erie County. Erie County retained the county seat, county records and most of the county officers.

scopecontent.head: Scope Note
scopecontent.p: Appointments of auctioneers, coroners, judges and justices, clerks, inspectors, sheriffs and notaries, 1808-1821; supersedes, 1810-1821; oaths of allegiance to the United States and to New York State, 1808-1823; oaths of office of county clerks, justices and commissioners, military officers, sheriffs, under-sheriffs, coroners and others, 1808-1820; orders of levy by Jonathan Bailey, James Sheldon, Oziel Smith, Samuel Wilkeson and other justices, including some receipts, 1813-1830; lists of qualified and disqualified jurors from Niagara County towns, 1808-1821; and a grand jury presentment, 1819.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection is arranged in seven series:
I. Appointments
II. Supersedeas
III Oaths of Allegiance
IV. Oaths of Office
V. Orders of Levy
VI. Jury Lists
VII. Grand Jury Presentment
.

did.unittitle: Clerk of Court of Common Pleas, inspector of pot and pearl ashes, inspector of hope, public notary, sheriff, under sheriff and jailer, 1810-1821

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.
